intro: Staelia harleyi, commonly known as the Harley's staelia, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, clustered umbels of white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and wetlands. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a hairy texture. Staelia harleyi is a perennial species that is native to parts of North America.
